Posted By: OmegaSerris (9/22/2011 5:01:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why does everyone compare this to [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning)? Lightning is an expensive rare... it's more mono-red oriented... and you can only use it for a turn. Sure, this guy is pretty bad, but he's not a strictly worse version of Ball Lightning.  
  
This guy is much more multi-color friendly. Just give him a [Distortion Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distortion Strike) or two, and you've got 14 damage over two turns. Then throw him away. Not the best option, of course, but certainly better than you guys are making him out to be.  
  
2/5
posts.html:

This guy is much more multi-color friendly. Just give him a Distortion Strike or two, and you've got 14 damage over two turns. Then throw him away. Not the best option, of course, but certainly better than you guys are making him out to be.

2/5

Posted By: Arachnos (9/13/2012 9:55:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is absurdly overpowered. It has more power than Rotting Fensnake. The sheer damage potential of hitting for 6 every turn from turn 6 onward is simply too much pressure for most decks in the current metagame to handle. Scoria Elemental is probably the next Stoneforge Mystic. It should probably be banned in Standard, and Modern too, just to be safe. At least Stoneforge Mystic could be mostly dealt with via artifact removal, but this monster only dies to creature removal, and who plays creature removal in standard?
posts.html:
